content: I completely agree with your view. the involvement of local musicians in archaeological music research can indeed help to elevate their cultural heritage and music. by working collaboratively with researchers, musicians can share their knowledge and perspectives, leading to better appreciation and recognition of their music beyond their communities. this can have a positive impact on the communities involved as well as the broader public who may have a chance to discover and appreciate the music. overall, involving local musicians in the research process can result in a mutually beneficial exchange that contributes to a better understanding and appreciation of different cultures and their musical traditions.
